name: glacially
content:
glacially adverb
(ICE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves a glacier (= a large mass of ice that moves slowly): The shifting ice produced the glacially dammed lakes to the southwest. Glacially fed, the water in the gorge was only a few degrees above freezing point.
If a place is glacially cold, it is extremely cold: The house was large, built of stone, and glacially cold throughout the year. On that glacially cold morning I stood shivering in the crowd. Synonym
freezing
used meaning "extremely" with other words that might also describe glaciers or ice: His work embodies a glacially cool perfection. He looks at me through glacially blue eyes.
More examplesFewer examplesThe route passes some other small, glacially formed lakes.Some of the quartz may have been glacially transported.This glaciation gave rise to at least three separate influxes of glacially derived material.

glacially adverb
(SLOWLY)
extremely slowly: Where the clean-up has occurred, it has moved glacially. Change is still glacially slow.
More examplesFewer examplesResearchers are making progress, if glacially.A country that cherishes the status quo is not going to change quickly, but it is moving forward glacially.The minister insisted that things were moving, albeit glacially slowly.
